titleStmt.title: Richard T. Jacob to James F. Robinson
CWG7715

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Frankfort October 7. 1862
Gov. Robinson
Dear Sir,

Should Major Moreau be broken by court martial the appointment of my friend Geo. Womack in his place would greatly gratify me. I know Mr Womack well and know him to be a high toned gentleman and that he would make a good officer. He aided me in raising my old fraction of a Regiment and would have been the Lt. Colonel but the consolidation prevented it. Thinking the good of the good of the State required it he cheerfully gave way. Take his claim into consideration and if you can commission him you would confer a great favor upon
